repnme.cdata!:
Kenya - Industrial Sector Adjustment
            Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The credit will support the first phase
            of the Government's medium-term adjustment program for
            the industrial sector. The key elements of the program
            include: (1) rationalization of the import licensing system
            and liberalizing imports of raw materials, intermediate and
            capital goods and some consumer goods; (2) reduced
            dispersion in tariff rates; (3) decontrolling prices of
            about 20 products and streamlining approval proccedures for
            goods remaining under price control; (4) improved incentives
            for export promotion, including manufacturing in bond,
            export finance, and a new import duty compensation scheme;
            (5) streamlining of investment procedures; (6) improved tax
            incentives for investment; (7) the development of an action
            program for restructuring the development finance
            institutions and their portfolios; and (8) limited financial
            sector reforms to activate the capital and money markets.
            The credit will finance general imports based on a negative list.
